intro: Campanula limonifolia, commonly known as lemon-scented bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its fragrant, lemon-scented leaves and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Campanula limonifolia is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma.
